name: Hearts Afire
overview: Hearts Afire is an American sitcom

episodes.name: Bees Can Sting You
episodes.overview: In the series pilot, John Hartman (John Ritter) searches for a press secretary for his boss, a U.S. Senator, and winds up with a roommate. Georgie: Markie Post. Sen. Smithers: George Gaynes. Dee Dee: Beth Broderick. Billy Bob: Billy Bob Thornton.

episodes.name: The Big Date
episodes.overview: John and Georgie (John Ritter) go on a date---a group one---and she's with George Hamilton (appearing as himself). Dee Dee: Beth Broderick. Mavis: Wendy Jo Sperber. Billy Bob: Billy Bob Thornton.

episodes.name: Three Men and a Bed
episodes.overview: Girl trouble makes for strange bedfellows when Strobe and Billy Bob with with John, who's bedridden with a fever. Strobe: George Gaynes. John: John Ritter. Georgie: Markie Post. Billy Bob: Billy Bob Thornton. Mavis: Wendy Jo Sperber.

episodes.name: John's Stallion
episodes.overview: Georgie's high-rolling father (Ed Asner) is released from prison and shows up at John's, where Georgie insists he stay. John: John Ritter. Strobe: George Gaynes. Dee Dee: Beth Broderick. Billy Bob: Billy Bob Thornton. Elliot: Clark Duke.

George: Edward Asner. Billy Bob: Billy Bob Thornton. Mavis: Wendie Jo Sperber. Strobe: George Gaynes. Adam: Adam Carl. Dee Dee: Beth Broderick.

episodes.overview: When his dream of opening a fast-food franchise in Cuba is dashed, George decides it's time to move on, leaving Georgie (Markie Post) feeling blue. John: John Ritter. Billy Bob: Billy Bob Thornton.

episodes.overview: Georgie and John write competing speeches for the Senator.

episodes.overview: Georgie has trouble with George dating Dee Dee (Beth Broderick). George: Edward Asner. John: John Ritter. Billy: Billy Bob Thornton. Mavis: Wendie Jo Sperber.

episodes.name: Take My Senate Seat, Please
episodes.overview: It's the senator's 75th birthday and he is still living in a Winnebago, which is now parked in the Harman's driveway. A scantily clad Dee Dee jumps out of the senator's birthday cake, which gives him plenty of unwanted publicity.
